name: Smith College Club of Oregon card
description: This card was designed for the Smith College Club of Oregon for the inaguration of Smith's new President. The text can be changed for other uses and events.

name: PrimoGraf Drawing Machine
description:
The PrimoGraf is a hand cranked drawing machine. Using wooden gears with prime number based gears an infinite array of drawings can be made. It comes complete with 7 gears, 2 set of rods and penholders so you can create many variations. Different setups can be achieved instantly by simply picking different holes.

Made of walnut, basswood, and solid brass. All the wooden parts and gears are made in our studio here in Portland, Oregon. 

I am making a new batch of 5 now. They will be ready to ship by May 25, 2013. This version differs from the photograph since the box now has walnut sides.

See it in action in a Youtube video:

<iframe title="YouTube video player" class="youtube-player" type="text/html" width="240" height="185" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/4pEqbs0ISaw" frameborder="0"></iframe>

name: Santa Pop-Up Theatre
description:
Christmas theatre filled with holiday cheer. Pull tabs animate the theatre.

Characters include Santa, a snowman, and a Victorian table full of presents (not pictured). There are reindeer and decorated trees in the winter scene behind.

The theatre folds flat and comes with a metallic paper folder and envelope.

name: Hansel & Gretel: a shadow theatre book
description:
A dark tale brought to life in five laser cut panels. You can read it as a book or project the artwork onto a wall with a flashlight.

Includes a suite of 5 lasercut pages created by Virginia Flynn.

I was drawn to the Hansel & Gretel fairytale because there are so many ‘official’ versions of the story. The original fairytale was so bleak that the Brothers Grimm felt the need to lighten it up. Over the years they changed it seven times. It was originally a story created by the depths of famine where parents were forced to kill their children... not exactly a lighthearted romp through the woods! We all know different versions of the story. I wanted the book to include the main touchpoints but be flexible enough so the reader could adapt it for any audience.

Virginia started with this idea and then created the wonderful papercuts that defined the story. We reduced the scale of her large format papercuts so they fit in a compact book. The lasercut artwork can be viewed as a book or projected to create a great shadow show on any wall. Each panel of art has a small amount of accompanying text to highlight the action. The text is not weighted with any one of the many versions so you’re free to tell your own story.

The book is extended with a website that includes different scripts, sound effects, and links to other Hansel & Gretel resources. It is a site where you can download mp3’s of sound effects to add to your shadow theatre show: birdsongs for the forest section, creepy wind sounds, and other sound effects. 

The books is bound by hand in Portland, Oregon. It comes in an acid free paper portfolio with a wooden base. Little walnut page holders in the shape of a witch’s cottage to keep the spreads open for show are included. 

Photography by www.bruceforsterphotography.com

name: Chroma Hat Pattern
description:
This project is a great stash buster. the ring of triple paneled squares around the sides were inspired by striped Tibetan aprons. As many as 45 colorways of sock yarn can be used or as few as two, up to you! Small amounts are needed of each colorway so you can use up odds and ends and trade colorways with friends. The pattern comes with ideas about color mixes and the advantages of employing complimentary colors, how to work with multiple colorways and how to accentuate design details using different color values.

I consider this Jazzknitting because of the way the colors are concentrated in the little panels encircling the crown and also because of the hat’s corrugated structure. It has a stranded false bind-off and a true 3-colorway ribbed bind-off to add to the colors that change throughout the hat.

This hat is both casual and dressy, colorful and fun.

Pattern is 10 full color pages, filled with photos of technical details.

This pattern is an electronic downloadable pdf. The link will be emailed to you within 8 hours--and usually sooner!

name: Two Foto Animator
description:
You can take just 2 pictures and make a movie. Think of the Two Foto Animator as an animated steam punk gif. How does it work? There's a special gear that puts in a pause as it spins around. When the brain see an arm that's up and then an arm that's down it think there must be motion. The brain then puts in all the in-between frames. Fantastic!

Since you're only using two photos for each movie, it's easy to produce your own animation cards. We even have special free software so you can easily make you're own cards.

The Two Foto Animator is made from cherry and walnut hardwood from Michigan finished with organic walnut oil. Brass fittings are used throughout. All the wood parts are lasercut in my own studio here in Portland, OR.  

The Animator comes with 3 printed sample cards, 3 frames for making your own cards, and 6 sets of blank cards so you can draw your own great movies. Each Animator includes a custom made metallic paper box with FSC plywood insets.

You can see the software and movie manuals at:

www.leafpdx.com/animator/

name: Jazzknitting: An introduction
description: Jazzknitting is a creative and liberating way to make the most of knitting's natural tendencies to curl, pool and stripe while using hand-painted yarns. Like Jazz musicians responding to each other's melodies, Jazzknitted shapes are directly affected by the dyer's decisions. Carefully chosen skeins can provide a wealth of possible knitted forms, each more intriguing than the next. Jazzknitting is fun and stress-free. There are no swatches or mistakes to make, no stitches to count, or charts to follow. Jazzknitting is truly knitting with no worries, yet unlike free-form knitting, there are principles guiding a variety of structural decisions. Jazzknitting: An introduction, tells the story of the design process that led to basic Jazzknitting techniques, one idea building on another.... Jazzknitting: An introduction, makes its debut at Sock Summit, Portland, OR Convention Center, July 28-31, 2011 in the Blue Moon Fiber booth in the marketplace where the author will be analyzing Tina Newton's beautiful skeins for Jazzknitting use.

name: Jazzknitting Butterfly Kit
description:
THE LAST 2 COPIES OF THIS BOOK! THE KIT WILL NOT BE MADE AGAIN.
It will become a downloadable book but without the yarn kit.

This kit includes patterns, inspiration, yarns and beads for 8 butterflies that cover a wide range of techniques. All of these designs have evolved by intentionally pooling hand-painted yarn while creating butterfly and moth shapes. As you knit these 8 butterflies, you will learn techniques to make your own designs for butterflies and larger projects. These patterns can also be used multiple times to produce the same shapes, but the color patterning will look completely different with different yarns.

The yarns provided in this kit are from fabulous hand-paint artists so you'll get to sample their work as you make the butterflies.

Butterfly making is great fun as you knit simultaneous symmetry on both ends of a double pointed needle. Asymmetry (knitting only one wing), pseudo symmetry (where the eye cleverly fills in the differences) and two ways of knitting true symmetry are covered, as are multiple ways of making bodies, legs and antennae. Some knitting skills are required and new techniques are clearly explained. Plus I am always available at our Jazzknitting group on Ravelry if you have questions. Please join us there and share pictures of your creations. I can't wait to see what you come up with!

Kit price $75 includes hand-dyed yarn strands that match mine, beads and invisible thread for all 8 "Kitflies" ($6 a butterfly!).

name: Round Sheep Knitting Needle Gauge
description: Needle gauge precision lasercut out of 1/8" cherry hardwood in US and metric sizing with 5-inch ruler.

name: Long Bunny Knitting Needle Gauge

name: Happy Family Knitting Needle Gauge
description: Needle gauge precision lasercut out of 1/8" cherry hardwood in US and metric sizing with 5-inch ruler.

name: Custom Needle Gauges
description:
Needle gauge precision lasercut out of 1/8" cherry hardwood with 5 or 6-inch ruler. They can have your shop or group name in small type with contact info or your logo or custom logo can be included.

Check out Sivia Harding's name in her hair!

Contact ilisha@LEAFpdx.com for pricing. Initial price varies depending on the amount of customization but the per each price remains the same.

name: Long Sheep Knitting Needle Gauge
description: Needle gauge precision lasercut out of 1/8" cherry hardwood in US and metric sizing with 6-inch ruler.

name: Round Bunny Knitting Needle Gauge
description: Bunny Needle Gauge precision lasercut out of 1/8th inch cherry hardwood in US and metric sizing with a 5" ruler.

name: 4 Vine Cards
description:
Pop-up geometric laser cut cards. Vine motif on the center panel.

Made from acid free metallic sparkly paper. Includes folder and envelope. Card measures 4-1/4 inches x 4-1/4 inches x 5-1/4 inches high.

Includes 4 cards, folders, and envelopes in assorted colors.

name: Miniature Tramp Art Button Sampler Larger Round
description:
Teeny tiny buttons sewn onto a teeny tiny doily framed in teeny tiny Tramp Art.

Tramp Art is a traditional American art form that was made from about 1880 to 1930. It likely had German roots and was made by creative Hobos who may have shared ideas for the decorative carving of layers of scrap wood (cigar boxes, fruit crates and the like) while sitting around campfires.

This button sampler (and all its components) were designed and made by Ilisha Helfman of Hestia House and LEAFpdx.

name: Emily's Dollhouse with all accessories (1/2 scale)
description:
A wonder-filled half-scale paper dollhouse (11” x 11-3/4” x 7”) that pops open to play and then folds away. Complete with front and back gardens and 33 pieces of beautifully decorated paper furniture, the dollhouse comes pre-assembled, so the fun can begin right away. 

The furniture is laser die-cut and easy for children and parents to assemble: just pop the tabs into slots, without the use of tape or glue. Includes the house with front garden, 33 pieces of furniture and all three accessory kits: the Parlor kit with Grand Piano, piano bench, sofa, adult doll, and rocking horse (plus an extra piano to "practice" on!) ; the Formal Garden with the garden, trellis, 2 mythological chairs, 2 ornamental chairs, fountain, 2 garden benches, and the child doll; and the Sewing Room which includes the sewing machine, sewing form, full length mirror, sofa, and folding screen.

This dollhouse collage celebrates patterns and design elements from the rich history of decorative art. For added fun, there are 50 hidden animals to find in the house and accessories! Emily’s Dollhouse explores pattern, color and design with children of all ages.

name: Retroscope: Tip Toe To Times Square
description:
Retroscopes are miniature versions of the old 'peepshow' style viewers. You turn the crank to see the movie. Turn slowly to see step by step action; turn the crank quickly to see the motion zip by. The reels are interchangeable so you can get extra movies.

This movie shows traffic going by in Times Square in NYC. As the usual cabs go by you'll see a gigantic bobble head dinosaur trying to get downtown. Not an easy thing to do for a giant bobble head or for the cabs either.

Construction utilizes a laser for ultra prescise fit. The laser allows us to make these parts in small batches: usually 10 at a time. It also allows us to do tricky things that make the paper cards hold up under intense play by children.

You can see a Quicktime movie of the Retroscope in action at:

www.sarabande.com/retroscope/retro_tip_toe.html

name: Miniature Button Card: Lady with Fan
description:
A lovely card made from a scan of an old print. Her fan is made completely of buttons and the card is a sampler of many button and buckle styles.

These tiny buttons and buckles are made by Ilisha Helfman of Hestia House (and LEAFpdx). They are glued to the card for display. Loose buttons and buckles for sewing are available separately.

The card is covered in removable clear plastic for protection and any white areas are reflections off the surface.

name: Time Traveling Paper Doll with flat pack Rocket
description:
A charming time traveler and her rocket. All conveniently flatpacked for shipping. The rocket is made of basswood with chlorine free metallic paper.

Height of the rocket is 6 inches. Its perfect for 1/2 scale dolls and robots.

Easy to assemble with no need for tape, glue, scissors, or rivets!

description: These tiny buttons and buckle are designed and made by Ilisha Helfman of Hestia House and LEAFpdx. They are glued to several cards, designed by Ilisha, which have been assembled into a display.

name: Miniature Buttons #1
description:
These tiny buttons are designed and made by Ilisha Helfman of Hestia House and LEAFpdx. 

These buttons are designed to be sewn with a John James #12 needle using Guttermann viscose or Sulky rayon thread, single strand, one pass through each hole only. These threads work well because they bloom into a little decorative dot in the center of the button, especially if they are in a contrasting color. I find silk thread has fibers that poke out and Mink thread is so fine its visual effect is negligible and unimpressive. Alternatively, the buttons can of course be glued. Some have been known to paint a little line of "thread" in the center.

This set of buttons is gold colored with red lines.

description: These tiny buckles are designed and made by Ilisha Helfman of Hestia House and LEAFpdx. They are very fragile and are only meant for decoration, not functional use.

name: Miniature Buckles #7
description: These tiny buckles are designed and made by Ilisha Helfman of Hestia House and LEAFpdx. While they are larger than the other buckles, they are still scale miniature size. They are fragile and are only meant for decoration, not functional use.

name: Bigger Buttons for Bigger Dolls #8
description: These buttons are not washable.

name: Storybook Cottage: Quarter Scale (DIY)
description:
Latticed windows help keep the wolf out while the welcoming rounded top door is inviting to any wandering hobbit.

A charming 1/4-scale dollhouse handmade by us in our studio in Portland, OR out of native cherry hardwood. Assembly is a breeze due to the precise lasercut notches. It can be assembled in less than a minute. Comes complete with a garden worthy base.

This dollhouse is perfect just as it is or you can decorate it with paint or wallpaper or paper clay or give it a thatched roof.... The Storbook Cottage can easily be made permanent with a few drops of glue or left unglued for easy disassembly and storage.

A perfect companion to any glass menagerie. It can live on an adult designer's shelf or on a child's desk. Dimensions are 4 inches wide x 3 inches deep x 3-3/4 inches high to the top of the chimney.

name: Delicate 7 Piece Puzzle: An Elegant Version of a Classic Tangram
description:
This elegant tangram is crafted from oiled cherry hardwood and easily fits in its box in your pocket. The puzzle pieces are pierced with Japanese floral stencil patterns. The tangram case box measures 3-1/2 inches square making it a perfect traveling companion or desk accessory. The thin puzzle pieces are lovely and delicate in the hand and make playing with this toy a pleasure and a delight. Using only 7 pieces that form a perfect square, it's possible to create all sorts of different characters. Nineteen puzzle solutions are offered with this set but the possibilities are infinite and inventing new ones is fun and addictive! 

Napoleon played with an ornate tangram set brought to him on Elba. Hopefully your time with this beautiful set will be just as pleasant or even more so since each piece is so lovely in the hand and the creative possibilities are endless.

A starter instruction sheet is included showing just a few of the characters you can make with this puzzle, but you'll be so delighted you'll be sure to come up with many more.

This set comes in a beautiful, slim wooden box, lined with metallic paper and covered with a metallic paper sleeve. It's an ideal very special gift for any occasion and one that will be treasured.

Handmade and designed in our studio in Oregon.

name: Tangram: Patterned Edition
description:
Our own over the top decorated version of the classic Tangram. Each of the pieces forms a frame for a wonderful patterned paper allowing for decorative figures. There are 10 different patterns offering endless variations. 

You can use wooden tangram pieces to make shapes, with or without the patterns. 

A starter instruction sheet is included showing just a few of the great possibilities you can make with this puzzle.

name: Butterfly Theatre
description:
This pop-up theatre arrives flat, pops open and comes with a playbook and characters ready to perform a modern day version of "The Princess and the Pea".

The play starts and ends in a fairly usual way but in the middle, the hungry princess eats the pea and gets so energized she stays up doing Pilates, completely confusing the queen who hears the ruckus. This charming twist will keep your viewers on their toes and delighted as they eagerly await your next move.

The theatre comes fully assembled and characters easily snap onto their wands. The curtain and 6 other set pieces slip into notches from the top of the theatre and change with ease throughout the play.

Theatre measures 4 3/4" x 9 1/8". Theatre and characters are quarter scale. Printed on acid free Italian sparkly cover stock.

name: Spinning Top - Series 4
Spinning Top - Series 1
Portland Tunnel Book: A visit to Portland on your desk
description:
Inspired by a 100-year-old postcard extolling Portland's virtues! Today Portland is all that it was and more: food carts, beer, the arts, Mt. Hood.... Pull the tunnel open and peek through the rose garlanded gates to get a taste of all that Portland has to offer.

Tunnel books have commemorated places and events for hundreds of years and now Portland has one of its own!

Share your love of Portland with this wonderful book. Designed, printed, lasercut, and bound entirely in Portland.

name: Larkspur: Wooden English 1920s Travel House with Cottage Garden in 1/2" scale
description:
Inspired by the portable dollhouses from the turn of the century, this finely crafted house is made of walnut and basswood. The sides are covered in archival giclée printed paper, filled with William Morris and Owen Jones designs. All the dollhouse parts pack into the box which serves as a garden base. Assembly is a breeze: slide the front and back into the base then add the sides, upper floor and roof.

This 1/2 scale dollhouse is a perfect addition to any collection. Each dollhouse is numbered and only 100 will be produced in this edition. It is crafted to provide years of fun and beauty. It will be introduced at the Chicago International Miniature Show on April 8, 2011.

The Larkspur with base measures 12-7/8 inches wide x 10-1/4 inches deep x 14 inches tall. Packed in the box it is 12-7/8 x 10-1/4 x 2-1/4 inches; perfect to fit in a suitcase or on any bookshelf.

name: Storybook Cottage Pop-Up Dollhouse
description:
Shutters on the front can keep the wolf out while the welcoming rounded top door is inviting to any wandering hobbit. 

A charming 1/2-scale dollhouse that comes complete with 5 pieces of easy-tab furniture. There are 2 chairs, a bed, a table, and a bureau.

A perfect companion to any glass menagerie. It can live on an adult designer's shelf or on a child's desk. Dimensions are 7-3/4 inches wide x 5-1/4 inches deep x 7-3/4 inches high to the top of the chimney.

name: Robot Kit
description:
KOKINO ROBOTO

What is It?
A beautiful cardstock toy model that is easy to assemble. The arms and head move.

How?
It is laser cut for complete precision. The cardstock is a heavy matte 15pt weight. Strong and sturdy.

What is it a model of?
The famous Atomic Powered Robot designed by a rogue team of Army engineers in the 1950s. Based on B. F. Skinner's famous pigeon guided missile, the kokino roboto uses a chicken for the brain. Atomic Power; Chicken Brain! What better combination. Sadly it was never built.

Construction:
All the pieces are laser cut. You do not need any tape, glue, scissors, or even much patience to put it together. Maximum time for assembly is 15 to 30 minutes.( An easy project; not one of those hard to construct paper card models.)

Just punch out the pieces and tab them together. There are complete step by step instructions.

name: Two Odd Volumes on Magic & Automata
description: The Sette of Odd Volumes published two fantastic books in the early 1890s. The Sette was a club of book collectors and eccentric personalities in London. It was founded by the famed book dealer Bernard Quaritch in 1878. He collected members for his club much like he did rare editons: each had an expertise in some unusual specialty. William Manning was a club member who gave an after dinner talk on his recollections of the great magician Robert-Houdin. When Manning was a young boy he met the great magician and befriended Robert-Houdin's sons. His 'recollections' about Robert-Houdin were later published as a small book. Reading it today, over a hundred years after the speech was originally given, one is still struck by how forward thinking Robert-Houdin was and how down to earth. He developed many famous magic acts that are still performed today. Originally trained as a clockmaker, Robert-Houdin built all his own automata and magic props. He experimented with electricity and even wired his house with clocks and alarms in the 1860s which must have seemed very magical indeed. Manning captures the spirit of his admired friend. His words make the magician seem very contemporary and even more remarkable. Manning's talk on Robert-Houdin prompted another member, Conrad William Cooke, to undertake a brief survey on the history of automata down through the ages. That talk resulted in the second wonderful book included here. Two Odd Volumes on Magic & Automata collects these two books into a single volume. Carefully reproduced from the original copies this book is a delight to read. It has been featured on Dug North's Automata blog as well as garnering great reviews in Magic magazines. Two books collected in one edition. 224 pages; 5-1/2 x 7 inches; paper cover. 38 illustrations $20 plus shipping. Includes a special gift!

name: Pop-Up Gardening Toy Theater
description:
Charming little fully assembled theatre that arrives flat, pops open and fits in the hand. Characters pop up and move with 3 pull tabs. 

First she waters (as she bobs up and down across the stage)... Garden grows... Bunnies come (bigger than life!)... Garden goes... (alas, as the bunnies do what bunnies will do...).

Characters include a Victorian woman watering her garden, two huge bouquets of flowers, and gigantic bunnies to eat the flowers. 

Comes complete with sparkling green metallic folder with the word "Grow!" lasercut and a beautiful metallic paper envelope. Size when opened is 5-3/4 inches wide x 5-3/4 inches high by 4 inches deep.

We lasercut them in our studio and assemble them by hand here in Portland, Oregon.

All our toys are handmade in small batches. Unfortunately this theatre is temporarily sold out. Please email us to find out when it will be available again.

name: Pop-up patchwork dollhouse (1/4 scale)
description:
This fun, fully assembled, pop-up house comes flat and pops open for play. Nine pieces of lasered, easy-tab furniture are included with simple instructions loaded with pictures. No scissors, tape or glue required.

Recommended for careful children and adults.

name: Pop-up archival white paper dollhouse (1/4 scale)
description:
This fun, fully assembled, pop-up house comes flat and pops open for play or display. Nine pieces of lasered, tabbed furniture are included with simple instructions loaded with pictures. No scissors, tape or glue required.

House measures 5-1/2" wide x 5-3/4" high.

Recommended for careful children and adults.

name: Owen Jones: Egyptian Ornament 7
description:
Wonderful digital collage reproduction of Egyptian page from Owen Jones "The Grammar of Ornament."

The digital file is 300 dpi and will open as a 30 megabyte file.

It is available for digital download immediately after purchase.
